title: C++ Basics: Data Types, Fundamental Objects, and Functions
description: Learn the fundamental building blocks of C++: data types, input/output, and basic function structure.
details: This section introduces you to the essential components of C++ programming. You'll learn about basic data types like int, float, double, char, and bool that store different kinds of information. We'll cover how to use cin to get user input and cout to display output. You'll also learn the basic structure of functions - how to write them, what they look like, and why they're useful. These are the building blocks you need to start writing C++ programs.

title: C++ Basic History
description: The History of C++. The when, how, why, and what of C++.
details: C++ is an Object-Oriented Programming language designed by Bjarne Stroustrup in 1985. Developed as an extension of another programming language C, hence why the '++' was added into the name of the language. C++ in the modern world is used in various fields of technology which includes things such as: game development, database systems, game graphics, and many more. Here I will provide you various resources of my own such as some minor projects to work on yourself and other external resources that are extremely valuable to you learning this language.

title: Big O Notation
description: A mathematical notation used to describe the performance or complexity of an algorithm.
details: Big O notation specifically describes the worst-case scenario and can be used to describe the execution time required or the space used by an algorithm. It helps developers understand how an algorithm's performance scales with input size.

title: Recursion
description: A programming technique where a function calls itself to solve a problem.
details: Recursion breaks down complex problems into simpler, similar subproblems. Every recursive function needs a base case to prevent infinite recursion and a recursive case that moves toward the base case.

title: Binary Search Tree
description: A tree data structure where each node has at most two children, with left child smaller and right child larger.
details: BSTs provide efficient searching, insertion, and deletion operations. In a balanced BST, operations have O(log n) time complexity, making them much faster than linear search for large datasets.
